answers.answer: You should have your thyroid levels checked I have a lot of thd same complaints because I have hypothyroidism.
Is it just a blood test or exactly how do u get it checked?!

Yes, you can get your thyroid checked with some basic blood tests. Allergies can make a person feel crummy, but I haven't heard that they can cause a person to feel dizzy or flushed.http://www.allaboutvision.com/conditions/eye-twitching.htmLists 8 causes of eye twitching.StressTirednessEye strainCaffeineAlcoholDry eyesNutritional imbalancesAllergiesI had some eye twitching when I was experiencing a magnesium deficiency. You could try a supplement to see if it helps. Other nutritional imbalances might also be worth exploring.

question: Ok. I really need some advice!!  I'm a 32 yr old female, 220 lbs, 4' 11'.  I currently take medication for blood pressure an pre-diabetes.....I also have anxiety, or so I've been told, however, I don't take medication for that I go to counselor. For the past few days I just haven't felt like myself, I get a fatigued feeling, my face will get flushed out of the blue, my bottom eyelid will twitch an occasionally ill get a dizzish feeling.   I've been to a doctor an they say it's allergies......that's hard for me to believe.  Any suggestions??  Am I over reacting??  What should I try??Thanks for any help!
title: I never feel good, it's like something is wrong...
